intro: Eroteum hirsutum, commonly known as the hairy eroteum, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and broad, ovate leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded undergrowth.
